intro: Tragia polygonoides, commonly known as the velvetleaf or false hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It is characterized by its rough, hairy leaves and showy yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of habitats, including gardens and wastelands. Tragia polygonoides is part of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. Its seeds are dispersed by wind, contributing to its widespread distribution in warm climates.
